A data analyst with over 15 years experience in the public and NGO sector, I am an expert in helping organisations use data to effectively monitor, evaluate and understand their impact.

Services | Projects | Professional History

» Services

Monitoring Data Systems

Design and implementation of bespoke solutions to collect, manage, analyse and report monitoring data.

Getting the right information to the right people at the right time is a key part of effective programme management. It enables you to make evidence-based decisions to deliver better programmes and better outcomes. Managing the data involved can be complex and time-consuming, but a well-planned system can ensure that data flows smoothly and meaningful information is available on demand.

Using serverless architecture which integrates third-party tools and existing operational systems, I deliver systems which are:

  • Appropriate and scalable: Building on existing systems and designed to meet your needs and capabilities. From simple business processes to complex requirements with highly variable programmes and multiple data sources

  • Complete: End-to-end solutions which close the loop of the programme cycle by integrating business processes and multiple data sources to deliver useful data when and where it’s needed

  • Efficient and cost-effective: Automated data flows and processing to reduce manual effort and free up resource for meaningful analysis and informed decision-making

Data Analysis and Reporting

From discrete projects such as analysis for evaluations or research, to regular on-going reporting for organisational learning and accountability.

From discrete, one-off projects to regular or on-going reporting, such as:

  • Analysis and reporting programme evaluations, research projects, reporting to funders or external publication.

  • Analysis of operational and impact data from internal, operational sources or external public datasets

  • Design of reports, dashboards, processes and datasets for regular operational, management or external reporting

Advice and Consultancy

Design and implementation of monitoring frameworks. Advice on reporting structures and business processes for impact monitoring.

Advice and consultancy on any aspect of impact monitoring, including:

  • Reviewing, analysing and consolidating internal or external reporting requirements

  • Reviewing or developing business processes around the collection, management or analysis of impact data

  • Development of monitoring frameworks, either for specific projects/programmes or at an organisational level including designing appropriate measurement methodologies and processes

» Projects

Client: Amnesty International – Human Rights Education

Project: Progress Report 2020 - Data analysis and validation

December 2020 – March 2021

The key deliverable of this project was to provide insights and analysis of data reported by Amnesty’s Human Rights Education (HRE) projects worldwide to inform the annual HRE Progress Report for 2020.  I developed an interactive tool in PowerBI which included comparative analysis and visualisations alongside reporting by country, region, strategic goal and project, based on 5 years worth of historical data which I compiled, normalised and validated. The tool provided the client with consistent, accurate and accessible reporting with uses beyond the initial scope of the project.

In addition, I undertook descriptive analysis and commentary on trends, highlights and other findings to inform the final Progress Report, plus detailed reporting on data quality assurance and methodologies.  I also developed automated update procedures to incorporate future data and provided advice and recommendations on subsequent data collections.

2020 HRE Progress Report

“…the Power BI ….is an absolute thing of beauty!!! Honestly, I can’t believe it exists! Thank you so much!!…

Honestly, completely game changing!”

Human Rights Education Advisor, Projects and Impact

Client: The School for Social Entrepreneurs (SSE), London, UK

Project: Data Management Solution & On-going Support

March 2019 – Present

This project delivered a bespoke data warehouse and business intelligence system to realise the potential of SSE’s data for evidencing its impact and managing its work. Based on a review of existing data and business process and a detailed analysis of requirements, we implemented a cloud-based, serverless warehouse solution which automates data flows from multiple sources into a flexible, but standardised structure for analytics. Microsoft PowerBI was deployed to roll out dashboards, reports and analysis across the organisation.

The project also included an overhaul of the organisation’s programme monitoring processes, including new tools which automated processes and integrated with various platforms to collect data from programme participants and facilitate management of the overall system.

Throughout the development and beyond, the client received ongoing support and capability for monitoring, reporting and analysis.

2018/19 Trustees Annual Report

2019/20 Trustees Annual Report

Project: Data Analysis & Support for Programme Evaluations

August 2020 – May 2021

Delivery of various services to support and contribute to external evaluations of SSE programmes including:

  • Assessment, review and advice on proposals, evaluation plans and evaluation reports

  • Expertise and guidance on programme impacts, datasets, collections, indicators and methodologies

  • Analysis of monitoring data to guide the evaluation and provide evidence for evaluation objectives

“…radically improved our data management…transformed our impact measurement…”

SSE Trustees Annual Report 2019/20

“…very excited to be getting my hands on the data… It is a total game-changer to see everything presented so clearly”

Head of Communications, SSE

» Selected Professional History

Senior Data and Reporting Analyst | Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Wellington, New Zealand

May 2018 – March 2019

  • Strategic leadership and management of the data, statistics and reporting function for the New Zealand Aid Programme

  • Management and development of the Aid Programme’s business intelligence system and database

  • Providing expert advice on all aspects of data and analytics for the Aid Programme

  • Development of performance reports, dashboards and analyses on monitoring, management and financial data

  • Line management of data and reporting analysts and mentoring of other staff on results management and data analysis

  • Advising on New Zealand’s contribution to developing statistical capacity in the Pacific

  • Providing expert advice and managing the input to international development data and transparency processes such as the SDGs and the International Aid Transparency Initiative, including representing New Zealand at the OECD in Paris

Business Lead – Reporting | Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Wellington, New Zealand

March 2016 – May 2018

  • Established new reporting and business intelligence system

  • Built business information layer to transform data for efficient and logical reporting and analysis

  • Developed reports, dashboards, analyses and data visualisations

  • Contributed to design and implementation of new Aid Management system

Monitoring and Results Advisor (Data and Statistics) | Ministry of Foreign Affairs and Trade, Wellington, New Zealand

October 2013 – March 2016

  • Advised and trained staff and partners on the design and implementation of monitoring and evaluation frameworks

  • Developed and managed the ‘Strategic Results Framework’ to monitor progress against the Aid Programme’s strategic goals

  • Developed a number of tools and systems to collect, analyse and disseminate crucial management information

  • Coordinated input to accountability products such as the Annual Report and Estimates of Appropriations, and supported audit requirements

  • Managed our engagement in Pacific regional statistics development and coordination, including representing New Zealand at international fora

  • Managed the publication of transparency data, in particular under the International Aid Transparency Initiative (IATI)

Senior Programme Advisor (Reporting) | Ministry of Social Development, Wellington, New Zealand
